pathAssistantSteps.info:
1. Meet with department heads to understand the problem(s) and proposed solutions addressed in Project. 
  2. Discuss desired timeline, scope, and prioritization (for requesting team). 
  3. Are other systems/teams impacted? 
  4. Is this replacing an existing process?

1. Outline system and labor requirements
  2. Prioritize project based on other BI projects
  3. Determined if new/updated SOP needs to be created and, if so, create new Key Result and assign to L+D

1. Establish project items and initial timeline for development & release
  2. Send proposed development & timeline to stakeholders through Chatter on Project record
  3. Determine UAT requirements to demonstrate successful implementation of project items

1. Team begins active development
  2. Project team and Team Lead meet to discuss status, immediate roadmap, potential blockers during Dev time during weekly project meeting
  3. List items created/changed for project on Project record (flows, fields, templates, etc.)

1. Team members selected for UAT phase. (Person that requests new feature/enhancement and team members if necessary)
  2. Perform UAT in FullCopy sandbox
  3. Determine any changes to be made/bugs to be fixed and, if necessary, move back to stage 4

1. Deploy features to production
  2. Confirm that everything was pushed through pipeline and permissions were assigned

1. Final SOPs and Release Notes delivered to users/attached to Project record
  2. Intro features to any relevant teams
  3. Debrief with stakeholders
  4. Add any undelivered or uncommitted project items to next iteration of project in new Project record
  5. If project replaced an existing process, turn off old automations, remove old fields/templates
